mosimage.caption: The Spring/Summer 16 campaign has been shot by ace photographer Mario Testino.

story.storykicker: As Spanish retail brand Massimo Dutti makes its debut launch in India, we take a look at what they have to offer.
story.storybody:
In the eternal search for the perfect, crisp, whitecollared shirt, Spanish label Massimo Dutti has come to the rescue with its smart range of dressing for men and women.

The label made its debut launch in the Capital recently at Select Citywalk mall, Saket and has already built a following among sharp dressers in the city. "Quality lies at the heart of the Massimo Dutti collections and this is ever true for Spring Summer 16 alongside impeccable cuts and finishes," shares a spokesperson of the brand with Lifestyle while speaking of the label that was started in 1985.

{mosimage} 

She adds, "The success of our collections lies in our ability to spot and adapt to customers' demands. Despite the fact that Massimo Dutti sells almost the same products in the 73 markets, our commercial team takes into account the different market preferences, which will result in little variations related to special features of each market."

{mosimage} 

Also read: Spanish brand Zara's sister brand, Massimo Dutti is debuting in India

The store houses a sizeable menswear range for casual, work and formal wear, and a separate women's line on the first floor. While men's T-shirts start at Rs 1,990, the highest priced jacket is Rs 24,990.

{mosimage}{mosimage} 

Accessories like socks are at Rs 490, while women's tops start from Rs 1,590. The brand comes under the Inditex Group, one of the largest fashion retailers in the world that also owns seven other fashion chains, namely Zara, Pull&Bear, Bershka, Stradivarius, Oysho, Zara Home and Uterque.

Regarding the production of the garments, the spokesperson reveals, "As with all Inditex brands, around 60 per cent of our products are made in, or close to our design and distribution centres in Spain, including Portugal, Morocco, and Turkey." Known for its high quality of fabric and durability, the store is a must-visit for clients who want to stand apart in even basic clothing.
